categories.name: Getting Started
categories.description: Learn the basics of using uChat and get started with your first conversation

articles.title: How do I create an account?
articles.content: Creating an account on uChat is straightforward. Click 'Sign Up' on the homepage or use the Google sign-in button for instant access. If using email, enter your address, username, and a secure password. You'll receive a 7-digit verification code via emailâ€”enter it to complete setup. Once verified, you can start adding contacts using the search bar.

articles.title: What is a handle and how do I choose one?
articles.content: Your handle is your unique identifier on uChat, similar to @yourname on other platforms. Handles must be 3â€“20 characters long and completely uniqueâ€”no two users can share the same handle. Choose something memorable and distinctive that represents you well.

articles.title: How do I send my first message?
articles.content: Once logged in, select a contact from your list or search for someone to start chatting. Type your message in the text box at the bottom and press Enter or click send. All text messages are protected by full end-to-end encryption, ensuring only you and your recipient can read them.

articles.title: How do I customize my profile?
articles.content: Navigate to Profile Settings by clicking the Profile icon on desktop or the three-dot More menu on mobile. Currently you can update your profile picture. Username and handle changes are coming soon in a future update.

categories.name: Messaging
categories.description: Everything you need to know about sending and managing messages

articles.title: How do I send a photo or file?
articles.content: Click the attachment icon (paperclip) in the message input area to send media or documents. Select images, videos, documents, or any file type from your device. uChat supports all file types up to 1 GB each. Note: media and files are currently not end-to-end encrypted, but this feature is in development.

articles.title: What are reactions and how do I use them?
articles.content: Reactions let you respond quickly without typing. Hover over any message (or tap on mobile) and click the emoji icon. Choose from emojis like ðŸ‘ â¤ï¸ ðŸ˜‚ and more. Reactions are securely linked to messages but aren't part of the encrypted content.

articles.title: Can I edit or delete messages after sending?
articles.content: You can delete your messages at any time. When deleted, the encrypted data is also removed from uChat's servers permanently. Message editing isn't available yet but will be added in a future update.

articles.title: How do I know if my message was read?
articles.content: uChat doesn't show read receipts to prioritize privacy and security. Displaying read receipts could compromise end-to-end encryption privacy, so we've chosen not to implement this feature.

articles.title: How does message encryption work in uChat?
articles.content: Every text message uses full end-to-end encryption (E2EE). Messages are encrypted on your device before sending, and only the recipient's device has the private key to decrypt them. uChat servers never see readable messagesâ€”they only pass encrypted data. Even we cannot decrypt your messages. E2EE currently applies to text messages only; media encryption support is being added soon.

categories.name: Contacts & Friends
categories.description: Manage your contacts and build your network on uChat

articles.title: How do I add someone to my contacts?
articles.content: Search for their username or handle using the search bar. When you find them, click 'Add' and they're instantly added to your contacts. No friend requests or waiting requiredâ€”it's immediate.

articles.title: How do I block or unblock someone?
articles.content: Blocking is currently handled manually. If you need someone blocked for valid reasons such as harassment or abuse, please contact us at ufonic.official@gmail.com with details and we'll assist you promptly.

categories.name: Group Chats
categories.description: Create and manage group conversations with multiple participants

articles.title: How do I create a group chat?
articles.content: Click the 'New Group' button in your chat list. Give your group a name and optional description, then add members from your contacts. You can also customize the group icon if desired. Once created, all members can send messages, share files, and participate.

articles.title: What's the maximum number of people in a group?
articles.content: uChat supports group chats with up to 256 members. For larger communities, we recommend using our Communities feature which supports unlimited members with extra moderation tools.

articles.title: How do I leave a group chat?
articles.content: Open the chat, click the group name at the top, scroll down and select 'Leave Group'. You'll no longer receive messages from that group, but your local chat history remains. Admins can remove members but cannot prevent them from leaving voluntarily.

articles.title: What are group admin permissions?
articles.content: Admins can add or remove members, change the group name and icon, manage settings, assign other admins, and moderate content. The group creator is automatically an admin and can promote other members to admin status.

categories.name: Privacy & Security
categories.description: Keep your account secure and understand uChat's encryption and privacy systems

articles.title: How secure are my messages?
articles.content: uChat implements true end-to-end encryption (E2EE) for all text messages. Messages are encrypted on your device before being sent and remain encrypted while traveling through uChat's servers. Only the recipient's device can decrypt them using their private key. Even uChat's servers cannot read your messages. Currently, E2EE applies to text messages only, while media uses standard HTTPS encryption until full E2EE media support is released.

articles.title: What exactly is End-to-End Encryption (E2EE)?
articles.content: E2EE ensures only the sender and receiver can read a message. Encryption keys are created and stored locally on each deviceâ€”not on uChat's servers. When you send a message, it's encrypted using the recipient's public key. Only their private key (stored on their device) can decrypt it. If intercepted or if servers were compromised, attackers would only see meaningless encrypted text.

articles.title: How does uChat's E2EE system work internally?
articles.content: When you start chatting, uChat's backend helps exchange public keys between devices. Each message is encrypted client-side with your key pair using strong cryptography (Sodium/NaCl library). The server simply passes the ciphertext alongâ€”it never accesses your encryption keys or decrypted data. On the recipient's side, their client decrypts the message locally. Media encryption is under development.

articles.title: How do I enable two-factor authentication?
articles.content: Two-factor authentication isn't currently supported. Our focus is on perfecting end-to-end encryption first, which already ensures your private messages remain unreadable to anyone else, including us. 2FA may be added in future updates.

articles.title: Who can see my profile information?
articles.content: Everyone can see your basic public information such as username and handle. Other dataâ€”like your email, encryption keys, or private informationâ€”are completely hidden and protected from public view.

articles.title: How do I report inappropriate content or users?
articles.content: Click the three-dot menu on any message or user profile and select 'Report'. Provide as much detail as possible about the issue. Reports are reviewed within 24 hours and serious violations may result in suspension or permanent bans.

articles.title: Who are unverified users?
articles.content: Unverified users haven't confirmed their email addresses. They could be bots, scam accounts, or users spreading inappropriate content. Don't share personal information, send money, or click suspicious links from unverified users. Block and report immediately if behavior is suspicious. If you are unverified, verify your email by following the homepage banner instructions.

categories.name: Settings & Preferences
categories.description: Customize your uChat experience and manage account settings

articles.title: How do I change between light and dark mode?
articles.content: uChat automatically detects your system theme preference and switches between dark and light modes accordingly. Change your operating system's theme settings to update uChat's appearance.

articles.title: Can I customize notification settings?
articles.content: The web version doesn't support notifications. For notification features, download the uChat Windows App from the Downloads page. The desktop app provides full notification support with customizable settings.

articles.title: How do I change my password?
articles.content: Go to Profile > Security > Change Password. Enter your current password, then your new one. Passwords are encrypted and stored securely. Make sure your new password is strong and uniqueâ€”avoid reusing passwords from other accounts.

categories.name: Account Management
categories.description: Manage your account, subscriptions, and account-related issues

articles.title: How do I delete my account?
articles.content: Go to Profile Settings and scroll to the bottom. Click 'Delete Account' and confirm by typing 'DELETE THIS ACCOUNT'. This action is irreversibleâ€”all encrypted keys and data will be permanently destroyed, making recovery impossible. Consider carefully before proceeding.

articles.title: Can I have multiple accounts?
articles.content: Yes, you can register multiple accounts with different emails. Remember that each account has its own unique encryption keys and cannot decrypt the others' messages. You'll need to log in and out to switch between accounts.

articles.title: I forgot my password. How do I reset it?
articles.content: Click 'Forgot Password' on the login page. Enter your email or username, and we'll send a reset link valid for 15 minutes. After resetting, your old encrypted data remains secure and cannot be read by anyone, including us.

articles.title: How do I verify my email address?
articles.content: After creating your account, we'll send a 7-digit verification code to your email. Enter it to confirm your email address. If you didn't receive it, check your spam folder or click 'Resend Code'. It might take up to 5 minutes to arrive.

categories.name: Troubleshooting
categories.description: Solutions to common problems and technical issues

articles.title: Messages are not sending. What should I do?
articles.content: If messages aren't sending, check your internet connection first. Try refreshing the page or restarting the app. Clear your browser cache and cookies if the issue persists. Ensure you're using the latest version of uChat. If none of these work, contact support for assistance.

articles.title: Why can't I upload files or images?
articles.content: File upload issues are usually due to size (max 1 GB per file) or slow connection speed. If problems persist, try using another browser or clearing your cache. Remember that media uploads are currently not E2EE-protected but still use secure HTTPS.

articles.title: The app is running slow or freezing. How can I fix it?
articles.content: Clear your browser cache and close unused tabs. Update your browser to the latest version. For the desktop app, restart it completely. On mobile, close and reopen the app or reboot your device. Performance should improve after these steps.

articles.title: I'm not receiving notifications. What's wrong?
articles.content: In the Windows app, make sure it's running in the background. You can verify this via Task Manager. If the app isn't running, notifications won't work. Restart the app if needed and ensure it's allowed to run in the background.
